CatDescriptText: Mr. Ernest R. Conley, 300 Liberty Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the minister has the most influence because the people are swayed more by emotion than reason."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ernest R. Conley, wearing hat with plaid band, moustache, and dark jacket and bow tie, holding items in left hand, standing on Liberty Avenue across from May Building, with pedestrians, automobiles, and sign reading "Mellon Bank"
